summary: why does codeflowauthorizer need a fhirsessioncontextholder
description: currently the sessionfactory creates a fhirsessioncontextholder and must be passed a codeflowauthorizer and somehow that codeflowauthorizer also needs to have a handle on the very same fhirsessioncontextholder that the sessionfactory uses
a cleaner solution might be to remove the fhirsessioncontextholder from the codeflowauthorizer and have the sessionfactory manage the context
this would mean eliminating the following line from codeflowauthorizer fhirsessioncontextholder.addauthorizationrequest(authrequest

summary: standalone launch shows the patient picker even if the scope isn't provided
description: standalone launch shows the patient picker even if the scope isn't provided
a standalone launch which doesn't provide the scope should succeed without the patient picker being shown

summary: hspc account user profile information mismatch
description: this is an indeterminate bug it only happens on occasion so it's difficult to diagnose and fix
when a user authenticates with firebase through the account app their profile data is synced to the database
for some reason this occasionally fails and there will be a mismatch between the firebase user directory and the firebase database records containing the user profile info
since the auth server retrieves user information from the database records this can cause problems when a user attempts to authenticate with using the auth server
to mitigate this i've been using the to identify such conditions and correct them

summary: handling of redirect from api server is incorrect
work with josh for details
description: involves an http redirect from api server authz server and so it depends on browser cookies for authorization i'm not sure on this but testing the public server seems to confirm
this is a mistake since launching is an admin act or requires appropriate scopes
the auth server doesn't know about such things
diagrams are confusing on this point showing launchendpointorchestration vs

summary: google group unable to register a cds hooks service due to cors issue
description: i am trying to register a cds hooks service but when i do i receive a typeerror failed to fetch popup with the console indicating response to preflight request doesn't pass access control check no header is present on the requested resource

however i have setup cors on my side and when i perform a curl command to perform an options request on my url i receive the following ok allow get options head get options post accept content-location location origin authorization server i have also listed the sandbox server explicitly in the field instead of using a wildcard but to no avail
is there something that i am missing here
